DataElement.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcome Oral Symptoms Mouth Pain Assessment Likert Scale Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A psychometric scale (0-10, with 0 being No pain and 10 being Worst pain imaginable or possible) for information regarding the Patient Completed Oral Symptoms assessment of mouth pain, collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptoms, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcome Oral Symptoms Mouth Pain Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information on the Patient Completed Oral Symptoms assessment of mouth pain, collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptoms, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Information collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptons, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.

Concepts.definition: Information collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptoms, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.

Property.preferredName: Oral Symptom Oral Cavity Pain Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.:The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting, or for use in the mouth.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement._Text; the words of something written.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A psychometric scale commonly used in questionnaires where a respondent is asked to evaluate an opinion according to subjective or objective criteria, by rating their level of agreement or disagreement with a statement.:Text; the words of something written.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to capture free text value for measures per request by Dr. J.Sloan. mc 11/14/12 Released for Alliance per request/approval by KA.Ziegler and K.Burger. mc 12/17/12

ReferenceDocuments.name: On a scale from 0 to 10, what
ReferenceDocuments.description: On a scale from 0 to 10, what number best describes your MOUTH PAIN due to your radiation treatment now? (circle one number)
